Package ohos.aafwk.ability

Class AbilityForm

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.aafwk.ability.AbilityForm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sequenceable

    public final class AbilityForm
extends Object
implements Sequenceable
    Displays brief information about another Ability.

    The following two roles are involved in the presentation of an AbilityForm depending on who provides or displays the content:

    • Supplier: Provides the AbilityForm content to be displayed. The supplier controls the display content and logic.
      • The supplier uses the singleton pattern.
      • One supplier can provide display contents for multiple clients.
    • Client: Displays the AbilityForm content. The client controls the AbilityForm layout.
      • A client can display the content provided by only one supplier.
      • Clients display the AbilityForm on AbilitySlice objects. Multiple clients can display AbilityForm contents on the same AbilitySlice.
      • Clients can use the layout component provided by an AbilitySlice to lay out AbilityForm instances displayed on the ability slice.

    The typical interaction process for a client to display an AbilityForm for the first time is as follows:
    1. The client calls the AbilitySlice#acquireAbilityFormAsync(Intent, OnAcquiredCallback) method to send an asynchronous request to the supplier through the AbilityForm framework to request the AbilityForm to be displayed.
    2. The AbilityForm framework calls back the Ability#onCreateForm() method on the supplier to notify the developer of the supplier to create an AbilityForm instance. You need to provide a layout file when creating an AbilityForm. You can also set attributes of components and register a listener for click events.
    3. The AbilityForm framework calls back the OnAcquiredCallback#onAcquired(AbilityForm) method on the client to notify the developer of the client in an asynchronous way that the AbilityForm display request has been processed.
    4. The developer of the client calls the AbilityForm#getComponent() method to obtain the root component of the AbilityForm, and uses the layout method provided in AbilitySlice to inflate the AbilityForm content to the layout of the client.

    The supplier provides the following functions:

    • Creating an AbilityForm: After the developer of the client calls AbilitySlice#acquireAbilityFormAsync(Intent, OnAcquiredCallback) to send an asynchronous request to the supplier through the AbilityForm framework to request the AbilityForm to be displayed, the AbilityForm framework calls back the Ability#onCreateForm() method on the supplier to notify the developer of the supplier to create an AbilityForm instance. You need to provide a layout file when creating an AbilityForm. You can also set attributes of components and register a listener for click events.
    • Setting component attributes: The developer of the supplier can set attributes of components on the client by calling methods such as AbilityForm#setText(int, String).
    • Setting a click listener: The developer of the supplier can call AbilityForm#registerViewListener(int, ViewListener) to listen for click events of specific components.

    The client provides the following functions:

    • Obtaining an AbilityForm: The developer of the client calls AbilitySlice#acquireAbilityFormAsync(Intent, OnAcquiredCallback) to send an asynchronous request to the supplier through the AbilityForm framework to request the AbilityForm to be displayed.
    • Releasing an AbilityForm: The developer of the client calls AbilitySlice#releaseAbilityForm(AbilityForm) to release an AbilityForm.
    • Controlling the AbilityForm layout: The developer of the client calls the getComponent() method to obtain the root component of the AbilityForm, and uses the layout method provided in AbilitySlice to inflate the AbilityForm content to the layout of the client.
    • Displaying complete AbilityForm content: The developer of the client calls startFullPage() to display the complete content of an AbilityForm.

    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Aafwk#ABILITY

    • Field Detail

      • PERMISSION_REQUIRE_FORM

        public static final String PERMISSION_REQUIRE_FORM
        Indicates the permission to obtain an AbilityForm.

        Applications functioning as the AbilityForm client, for example, the home screen, must have this permission. This permission is not available to third-party applications.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PRODUCER

        public static final Sequenceable.Producer<AbilityForm> PRODUCER
        Creates a AbilityForm instance from a Parcel.
        Since:
        4

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbilityForm

        public AbilityForm​(int resId,
                   Context context)
        A constructor used to create an AbilityForm instance on the AbilityForm supplier.

        The supplier uses this constructor to create an instance in response to the Ability#onCreateForm() method.

        Parameters:
        resId - Indicates the id of the layout resource file of the AbilityForm.
        context - Indicates the Ability context, which is used for asynchronous message processing of the AbilityForm supplier.

    • Method Detail

        Parameters:
        out - Indicates the Parcel object for marshalling.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the marshalling is successful; returns false otherwise.

        public boolean unmarshalling​(Parcel in)

        Specified by:
        unmarshalling in interface Sequenceable
        Parameters:
        in - Indicates the Parcel object for unmarshalling.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the unmarshalling is successful; returns false otherwise.

      • getFullPageIntent

        public Intent getFullPageIntent​()
        Obtains the Intent for starting full page display.

        You can use helper methods such as Ability.LayoutParamsHelper#setX(int) to set the display area for full page in the obtained Intent, and then use the AbilityForm#setFullPageIntent(Intent) method to pass the modified Intent back to the AbilityForm.

        Returns:
        Returns the Intent for starting full page display.
        See Also:
        startFullPage(), setFullPageIntent(Intent)

      • setText

        public void setText​(int componentId,
                    String text)
        Sets the text to be displayed for a specific component on the AbilityForm supplier.
        Parameters:
        componentId - Identifies the component to be set. The value cannot be a negative number.
        text - Indicates the text to be displayed.

      • setTextSize

        public void setTextSize​(int componentId,
                        int size)
        Sets the font size of a specific component on the AbilityForm supplier.
        Parameters:
        componentId - Identifies the component to be set. The value cannot be a negative number.
        size - Indicates the font size to be set. The value must be greater than 0.

      • sendActions

        public void sendActions​(ComponentProvider remoteComponentActions)
        Sends the supplier's actions configured in the ComponentProvider object to the client.

        The AbilityForm framework then applies these actions on the client for the actions to take effect.

        Parameters:
        remoteComponentActions - Indicates the actions to be sent to the client.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if client stub is in a wrong state

      • getComponent

        public Component getComponent​()
        Obtains the root component of an AbilityForm from the supplier.
        Returns:
        Returns the root component.
        Since:
        4

      • registerViewListener

        public boolean registerViewListener​(int componentId,
                                    ViewListener listener)
        Registers a listener by the AbilityForm supplier to listen for click events of a component on the AbilityForm client.
        Parameters:
        componentId - Identifies the component to be listened on. The value cannot be a negative number.
        listener - Indicates the callback method to be called when a component is clicked.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the registration is successful; returns false otherwise.

      • startFullPage

        public void startFullPage​()
        Switches to full page display of the AbilityForm by the AbilityForm client.

        Typically, the AbilityForm client starts the full page display by performing the following steps:

        1. The client uses AbilityForm#getFullPageIntent() in AbilityForm.OnAcquiredCallback#onAcquired(AbilityForm) to obtain the Intent for starting full page display.
        2. The client uses methods such as Ability.LayoutParamsHelper#setX(int) to set layout parameters in the obtained Intent.
        3. The client calls AbilityForm#setFullPageIntent(Intent) to pass the configured Intent back to the AbilityForm.

        See Also:
        setFullPageIntent(Intent), getFullPageIntent()

      • setFullPageIntent

        public void setFullPageIntent​(Intent intent)
        Sets the Intent used for starting full page display.

        After calling AbilityForm#getFullPageIntent() to obtain the Intent for starting full page display, the client can set Intent parameters and then call the current method to pass the Intent back to the AbilityForm.

        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates the Intent for starting full page display.
        See Also:
        startFullPage(), getFullPageIntent()
